Field.FormMenuDescription: Fagerstrom Test for Cigarette Dependence (formerly Fagerstrom Test for Nicotine Dependence)
Field.ElementLabel: 1. How soon after you wake up do you smoke your first cigarette?

ElementEnum.RawValue:
3, a. Within 5 minutes (3 points) 
 2, b. Within 6-30 minutes (2 points) 
 1, c. Within 31-60 minutes (1 point) 
 0, d. After 60 minutes (0 points)

Field.ElementLabel:
2. Do you find it difficult to refrain from smoking in places where it is forbidden (e.g., in
church, at the library, in cinema, etc)?

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, a. Yes (1 point) \n 0, b. No (0 points)

Field.ElementLabel: 3. Which cigarette would you hate most to give up?

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, a. The first one in the morning (1 point) \n 0, b. Any other (0 points)

StructuredValue.Value: a. The first one in the morning (1 point)

Field.ElementLabel: 4. How many cigarettes per day do you smoke?

ElementEnum.RawValue:
0, a. 10 or less (0 points) 
 1, b. 11-20 (1 point) 
 2, c. 21-30 (2 points) 
 3, d. 31 or more (3 points)

Field.ElementLabel: 5. Do you smoke more during the first hours after waking than during the rest of the day?

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, a. Yes (1 point) \n 0, b. No (0 points)

Field.ElementLabel: 6. Do you smoke even when you are ill enough to be in bed most of the day?

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, a. Yes (1 point) \n 0, b. No (0 points)

Field.ElementLabel:
Now add up your points.

How did you score?

A score of 5 or more indicates a significant dependence, while a score of 4 or less shows
a low to moderate dependence.
